data.title: Ikea takes over former Debenhams premises
data.meta_description: Debenhams' Churchill Square store will be taken over by Ikea as the Swedish homeware retailer's owner announces the acquisition of the Brighton shopping centre.
data.text:
This morning (13 November), Ikea-owner Ingka Group announced its acquisition of the Brighton-based Churchill Square Shopping Centre.

The deal, estimated to be worth £145m, will see the former Debenhams unit inside the shopping centre reopened as an Ikea City Store.

The two-storey space has stood unoccupied since 15 May 2021 following Debenhams's £55m sale to Boohoo Group in January 2021.

Under the new ownership, Debenhams has been repositioning itself as a digital department store.

Ikea UK and Ireland country retail manager and chief sustainability officer, Peter Jelkeby said: “We will step up our omnichannel investments, both in Brighton and the rest of the country, with a simple goal: to become more customer centric.”
